Framlingham Library

Manager: Patricia Adkins

The Old Court House, Bridge Street, Framlingham
IP13 9AJ

  • Tel: 01728 723735
  • Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
  • Friends group: Framlingham Town Council
  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday 1000 – 1200
Tuesday 0930 – 1730
Wednesday Closed
Thursday 0930 – 1730
Friday 0930 – 1730
Saturday 0930 – 1700
Sunday 1100 – 1600

Room & venue hire

Room and space hire at Framlingham Library →

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: available
  • Also available:
    • Framlingham Town Council services Mon-Thu 10am-4pm and at other times by arrangement. See the Framlingham Town Council website.
    • Used postage stamp collection point in aid of St Elizabeth's Hospice

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Photocopying: available
  • Colour printing: available
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Baby Bounce and Tot Rock

Friday, 0900-0930

Stories and rhymes for pre-school children.

Find out more about Wordplay

Children's craft club

Sunday, 1100-1200

Lots of fun projects suitable for different age groups. Contact the library for more details.

Children's reading drop-in: for 5-7 year-olds

Tuesday, 1515-1615

Pop in to find some encouragement or help in your reading, or interact with other bookworms. Bring your own book or borrow one of ours. Term-time only.

Lego club: for all ages

Saturday, 1030-1130

Reading groups

Mrs Fram Library reading group

second Wednesday of the month, 1930-2030

Second Fram Library reading group

fourth Wednesday of the month, 1930-2030

Writing groups

Free creative writing class: for 16 year olds and older

first Saturday of the month, 1400-1600

IT help

IT support and troubleshooting. Get help and advice on any aspect of your tablet, laptop or phone. Free but donations appreciated.

every other Friday, 0930-1300

Arts, crafts & games

Adult colouring in club

Thursday, 1400-1600

All materials and refreshments provided but donations welcome.

Board game club: try a different featured game every week!

Currently on hiatus, returning in 2020., 1400-1600

Knit and Natter

Thursday, 1400-1600

Free drop-in and meet-up with other crafty Sew ‘n’ So’s

Councillor surgeries & professional advice

Citizens' Advice Bureau: free advisory service

Friday, 1000-1200

Upcoming special events

No upcoming special events.
